content.raw:
**Notes:**

1. For inputting thrusters, we need to add <gazebo></gazebo> part of macro that is different from the sensors macro currently in `utils.py`. We will need to store engine types and names. How do this without disrupting sensor config api? Maybe have another parameter checking if it is engine, then add this?

```
  <gazebo>
    <plugin name="wamv_gazebo_thrust" filename="libusv_gazebo_thrust_plugin.so">
      <cmdTimeout>1.0</cmdTimeout>
      <xacro:include filename="$(find wamv_gazebo)/urdf/thruster_layouts/wamv_gazebo_thruster_config.xacro" />
      <xacro:wamv_gazebo_thruster_config name="left" />
      <xacro:wamv_gazebo_thruster_config name="right" />
    </plugin>
  </gazebo>
```

‌

1. How to change param names in `generate_thrusters.launch` to not affect `generate_sensors.launch`? `available, requested, xacro_target, wamv_target, wamv_gazebo` namespace them?
2. Consistent visual spacing in `macro_block_gen()`
3. Currently `generate_sensors.launch` creates target `my_sensors.xacro` file and then `my_wamv.urdf` file by calling `xacro xacro --inorder -o`. Preferably we can get both `my_sensors.xacro` and `my_thrusters.xacro` before compiling to get the `urdf` file to get both. How best to change this?
content.html:
Notes:

  1. For inputting thrusters, we need to add <gazebo></gazebo> part of macro that is different from the sensors macro currently in utils.py. We will need to store engine types and names. How do this without disrupting sensor config api? Maybe have another parameter checking if it is engine, then add this?
  <gazebo>
    <plugin name="wamv_gazebo_thrust" filename="libusv_gazebo_thrust_plugin.so">
      <cmdTimeout>1.0</cmdTimeout>
      <xacro:include filename="$(find wamv_gazebo)/urdf/thruster_layouts/wamv_gazebo_thruster_config.xacro" />
      <xacro:wamv_gazebo_thruster_config name="left" />
      <xacro:wamv_gazebo_thruster_config name="right" />
    </plugin>
  </gazebo>

‌

  1. How to change param names in generate_thrusters.launch to not affect generate_sensors.launch? available, requested, xacro_target, wamv_target, wamv_gazebo namespace them?
  2. Consistent visual spacing in macro_block_gen()
  3. Currently generate_sensors.launch creates target my_sensors.xacro file and then my_wamv.urdf file by calling xacro xacro --inorder -o. Preferably we can get both my_sensors.xacro and my_thrusters.xacro before compiling to get the urdf file to get both. How best to change this?

content.raw: 1\.2 Put the rosparams in namespace `thruster_config` [eeee32c](#!/osrf/vrx/commits/eeee32ca03b79d6350408178c7972edbe05a16cb)
content.html: 1.2 Put the rosparams in namespace thruster_config eeee32c

content.raw: 1\.1 I added a `macro_type` parameter to `macro_block_gen()` that defaults to `""`. I check if `macro_type=="engine"` to add the gazebo tags.
content.html: 1.1 I added a macro_type parameter to macro_block_gen() that defaults to "". I check if macro_type=="engine" to add the gazebo tags.

content.raw:
I have a question about `wamv_gazebo.xacro`.

**Current: wamv\_gazebo.xacro**

```
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<robot xmlns:xacro="http://ros.org/wiki/xacro">
  <!-- Macro to create a WAM-V with dyanmics plugins and a customizeable thruster layout -->
  <xacro:macro  name="wamv_gazebo" params="thruster_layout">
    <!-- Include macros for dynamics plugins -->
    <xacro:include filename="$(find wamv_gazebo)/urdf/macros.xacro" />
    <!-- Defines the base vehicle -->
    <xacro:include filename="$(find wamv_description)/urdf/wamv_base.urdf.xacro" />
    <!-- Thruster Layout -->
    <xacro:include filename="${thruster_layout}"/>
    <!-- Attach hydrodynamics plugin -->
    <xacro:usv_dynamics_gazebo name="wamv_dynamics_plugin"/>
    <!-- Attach wind plugin -->
    <xacro:usv_wind_gazebo name="wamv_wind_plugin"/>
  </xacro:macro>
</robot>
```

Is there a reason that the `wamv_gazebo` macro is defined this way? It definitely works, but I thought that it might be cleaner to have something like

**Alternative file idea: wamv\_gazebo\_plugins.xacro**

```
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<robot xmlns:xacro="http://ros.org/wiki/xacro">
  <!-- Macro to setup dynamics plugins -->
  <xacro:macro  name="wamv_gazebo_plugins">
    <!-- Include macros for dynamics plugins -->
    <xacro:include filename="$(find wamv_gazebo)/urdf/macros.xacro" />
    <!-- Attach hydrodynamics plugin -->
    <xacro:usv_dynamics_gazebo name="wamv_dynamics_plugin"/>
    <!-- Attach wind plugin -->
    <xacro:usv_wind_gazebo name="wamv_wind_plugin"/>
  </xacro:macro>
</robot>
```

This way, we could decouple the thruster layouts from the base and dynamics plugins. Does it need to be in this order? Was this made to be more concise?

**Current: wamv\_gazebo.urdf.xacro \(dynamics and base coupled with thruster confs\)**

```
    <!-- Default WAM-V with two aft thrusters -->
    <xacro:if value="${thruster_conf == 'H'}">
       <xacro:wamv_gazebo thruster_layout="$(find wamv_gazebo)/urdf/thruster_layouts/wamv_aft_thrusters.xacro"/>
    </xacro:if>

    <!-- WAMV with "T" thruster configuration -->
    <xacro:if value="${thruster_conf == 'T'}">
      <xacro:wamv_gazebo thruster_layout="$(find wamv_gazebo)/urdf/thruster_layouts/wamv_t_thrusters.xacro"/>
    </xacro:if>

    <!-- WAMV with "X" thruster configuration -->
    <xacro:if value="${thruster_conf == 'X'}">
      <xacro:wamv_gazebo thruster_layout="$(find wamv_gazebo)/urdf/thruster_layouts/wamv_x_thrusters.xacro"/>
    </xacro:if>
```

**Alternative: wamv\_gazebo.urdf.xacro**

```
  <!-- Setup base separately -->
  <xacro:include filename="$(find wamv_description)/urdf/wamv_base.urdf.xacro" />

  <!-- Setup plugins separately -->
  <xacro:wamv_gazebo_plugins/>

    <!-- Default WAM-V with two aft thrusters -->
    <xacro:if value="${thruster_conf == 'H'}">
       <xacro:include filename="$(find wamv_gazebo)/urdf/thruster_layouts/wamv_aft_thrusters.xacro"/>
    </xacro:if>

    <!-- WAMV with "T" thruster configuration -->
    <xacro:if value="${thruster_conf == 'T'}">
      <xacro:include filename="$(find wamv_gazebo)/urdf/thruster_layouts/wamv_t_thrusters.xacro"/>
    </xacro:if>

    <!-- WAMV with "X" thruster configuration -->
    <xacro:if value="${thruster_conf == 'X'}">
      <xacro:include filename="$(find wamv_gazebo)/urdf/thruster_layouts/wamv_x_thrusters.xacro"/>
    </xacro:if>
```

I was just wondering because it confused me for a while and I wanted to check if this was intentional or not. Thank you!

I have a question about wamv_gazebo.xacro.

Current: wamv_gazebo.xacro

<?xml version="1.0"?>
<robot xmlns:xacro="http://ros.org/wiki/xacro">
  <!-- Macro to create a WAM-V with dyanmics plugins and a customizeable thruster layout -->
  <xacro:macro  name="wamv_gazebo" params="thruster_layout">
    <!-- Include macros for dynamics plugins -->
    <xacro:include filename="$(find wamv_gazebo)/urdf/macros.xacro" />
    <!-- Defines the base vehicle -->
    <xacro:include filename="$(find wamv_description)/urdf/wamv_base.urdf.xacro" />

    <xacro:include filename="${thruster_layout}"/>

Is there a reason that the wamv_gazebo macro is defined this way? It definitely works, but I thought that it might be cleaner to have something like

</robot>

This way, we could decouple the thruster layouts from the base and dynamics plugins. Does it need to be in this order? Was this made to be more concise?

Current: wamv_gazebo.urdf.xacro (dynamics and base coupled with thruster confs)

    <!-- Default WAM-V with two aft thrusters -->
    <xacro:if value="${thruster_conf == 'H'}">
       <xacro:wamv_gazebo thruster_layout="$(find wamv_gazebo)/urdf/thruster_layouts/wamv_aft_thrusters.xacro"/>

    <!-- WAMV with "X" thruster configuration -->

Alternative: wamv_gazebo.urdf.xacro

  <!-- Setup base separately -->
  <xacro:include filename="$(find wamv_description)/urdf/wamv_base.urdf.xacro" />

  <!-- Setup plugins separately -->
  <xacro:wamv_gazebo_plugins/>

    <!-- Default WAM-V with two aft thrusters -->
    <xacro:if value="${thruster_conf == 'H'}">
       <xacro:include filename="$(find wamv_gazebo)/urdf/thruster_layouts/wamv_aft_thrusters.xacro"/>
    </xacro:if>

    <!-- WAMV with "T" thruster configuration -->
    <xacro:if value="${thruster_conf == 'T'}">
      <xacro:include filename="$(find wamv_gazebo)/urdf/thruster_layouts/wamv_t_thrusters.xacro"/>
    </xacro:if>

    <!-- WAMV with "X" thruster configuration -->
    <xacro:if value="${thruster_conf == 'X'}">
      <xacro:include filename="$(find wamv_gazebo)/urdf/thruster_layouts/wamv_x_thrusters.xacro"/>
    </xacro:if>

I was just wondering because it confused me for a while and I wanted to check if this was intentional or not. Thank you!

content.raw:
I like your suggestion about moving the wamv Gazebo plugins to its own xacro file. However, these plugins are in process of being converted to world plugins for other reasons. Based on that it’s probably not worth the effort to refactor it, but I shared your thoughts about the cleaner layout.

For the other questions, maybe @{5ce2e28709c5fa0fd9fb0c6c} can reply. He has a better understanding of how the sensor generation works and how to reuse it here.
content.html:
I like your suggestion about moving the wamv Gazebo plugins to its own xacro file. However, these plugins are in process of being converted to world plugins for other reasons. Based on that it’s probably not worth the effort to refactor it, but I shared your thoughts about the cleaner layout.

For the other questions, maybe @Marshall Rawson can reply. He has a better understanding of how the sensor generation works and how to reuse it here.

content.raw: That makes sense. I will work with it how it is now then and we can readjust when the world plugins are made.
content.html: That makes sense. I will work with it how it is now then and we can readjust when the world plugins are made.

content.raw:
@{5ce2e28709c5fa0fd9fb0c6c} so far, I have implemented the `generate_thrusters` PR to near identically mirror the `generate_sensors` behavior. The main design decisions are:

* How could a user generate sensors AND thrusters? Should it be a `generate_thrusters_and_sensors` approach? I feel that there could be okay, but if other types of parts need to be added, then `generate_thrusters_and_sensors_and_parts` is not nice. Perhaps we could simplify generate\_thrusters and generate\_sensors behavior to simply output the `my_senors.xacro` file and not immediately output the `my_wamv.urdf` file. This way the flow could be:

1. Generate xacro files for thrusters and sensors

`roslaunch vrx_gazebo generate_sensors.launch requested:=/home/tylerlum/my_wamv/sensor_config.yaml xacro_target:=/home/tylerlum/my_wamv/my_sensors.xacro`

`roslaunch vrx_gazebo generate_sensors.launch requested:=/home/tylerlum/my_wamv/thruster_config.yaml xacro_target:=/home/tylerlum/my_wamv/my_thrusters.xacro`

2\. Compile urdf

`rosrun xacro xacro --inorder -o /home/tylerlum/my_wamv/my_wamv_sensors_and_thrusters.urdf '/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/wamv_gazebo/urdf/wamv_gazebo.urdf.xacro' yaml_sensor_generation:=true sensor_xacro_file:=/home/tylerlum/my_wamv/my_sensors.xacro yaml_thruster_generation:=true thruster_xacro_file:=/home/tylerlum/my_wamv/my_thrusters.xacro`

3\. Use urdf

`roslaunch vrx_gazebo sandisland.launch urdf:=/home/tylerlum/my_wamv/my_wamv_sensors_and_thrusters.urdf`

‌

OR we could make a high level launch file that takes in optional yaml files as parameters

1. Generate urdf

`roslaunch vrx_gazebo generate_wamv.launch sensor_yaml:=/home/tylerlum/my_wamv/sensor_config.yaml thruster_yaml:=/home/tylerlum/my_wamv/thruster_config.yaml wamv_target:=/home/tylerlum/my_wamv/my_wamv.urdf`

This would have `sensor_yaml` and `thruster_yaml` as optional parameters. If set, they use `generate_thrusters` or `generate_sensors` to make the xacro files, then use them both with the rosrun xacro command above. The `xacro_target` s could default be set to be stored in the same directory as the yaml file and with the same file name.

2\. Use urdf

`roslaunch vrx_gazebo sandisland.launch urdf:=/home/tylerlum/my_wamv/my_wamv.urdf`
content.html:
@Marshall Rawson so far, I have implemented the generate_thrusters PR to near identically mirror the generate_sensors behavior. The main design decisions are:

  • How could a user generate sensors AND thrusters? Should it be a generate_thrusters_and_sensors approach? I feel that there could be okay, but if other types of parts need to be added, then generate_thrusters_and_sensors_and_parts is not nice. Perhaps we could simplify generate_thrusters and generate_sensors behavior to simply output the my_senors.xacro file and not immediately output the my_wamv.urdf file. This way the flow could be:
  1. Generate xacro files for thrusters and sensors

roslaunch vrx_gazebo generate_sensors.launch requested:=/home/tylerlum/my_wamv/sensor_config.yaml xacro_target:=/home/tylerlum/my_wamv/my_sensors.xacro

roslaunch vrx_gazebo generate_sensors.launch requested:=/home/tylerlum/my_wamv/thruster_config.yaml xacro_target:=/home/tylerlum/my_wamv/my_thrusters.xacro

2. Compile urdf

rosrun xacro xacro --inorder -o /home/tylerlum/my_wamv/my_wamv_sensors_and_thrusters.urdf '/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/wamv_gazebo/urdf/wamv_gazebo.urdf.xacro' yaml_sensor_generation:=true sensor_xacro_file:=/home/tylerlum/my_wamv/my_sensors.xacro yaml_thruster_generation:=true thruster_xacro_file:=/home/tylerlum/my_wamv/my_thrusters.xacro

3. Use urdf

roslaunch vrx_gazebo sandisland.launch urdf:=/home/tylerlum/my_wamv/my_wamv_sensors_and_thrusters.urdf

‌

OR we could make a high level launch file that takes in optional yaml files as parameters

  1. Generate urdf

roslaunch vrx_gazebo generate_wamv.launch sensor_yaml:=/home/tylerlum/my_wamv/sensor_config.yaml thruster_yaml:=/home/tylerlum/my_wamv/thruster_config.yaml wamv_target:=/home/tylerlum/my_wamv/my_wamv.urdf

This would have sensor_yaml and thruster_yaml as optional parameters. If set, they use generate_thrusters or generate_sensors to make the xacro files, then use them both with the rosrun xacro command above. The xacro_target s could default be set to be stored in the same directory as the yaml file and with the same file name.

2. Use urdf

roslaunch vrx_gazebo sandisland.launch urdf:=/home/tylerlum/my_wamv/my_wamv.urdf

content.raw:
Hi Tyler, I think that the way that will make the most sense for teams to do is to configure sensors and thrusters at the same time. So, what you could do is rename

`vrx_gazebo/bin/generate_sensors`

to something like

`generate_my_super_cool_custom_wamv`

where the executable not only generates a sensor xacro, but also generates a thrusters xacro \(each filled with the already existing xacro macro calls\).

You would also need to go and add some more parameters to the `launch/generate_sensors.launch` \(probably rename that too\)

and the `rosrun xacro xacro --inorder` command would need to moved out of configure\_sensors.py and probably placed into

`generate_my_super_cool_wamv`

Also, some more args would need to be added to the `wamv_gazebo.urdf.xacro` similar to `yaml_sensor_generation`

Also, probably the Wiki page/tutorial would need to be updated/renamed

Also, if you feel like you want to change behavior or agrs or anything in utils.py to better suit your needs, go for it, it is definitely not as generic or simple as it could be!
content.html:
Hi Tyler, I think that the way that will make the most sense for teams to do is to configure sensors and thrusters at the same time. So, what you could do is rename

vrx_gazebo/bin/generate_sensors

to something like

generate_my_super_cool_custom_wamv

where the executable not only generates a sensor xacro, but also generates a thrusters xacro (each filled with the already existing xacro macro calls).

You would also need to go and add some more parameters to the launch/generate_sensors.launch (probably rename that too)

and the rosrun xacro xacro --inorder command would need to moved out of configure_sensors.py and probably placed into

generate_my_super_cool_wamv

Also, some more args would need to be added to the wamv_gazebo.urdf.xacro similar to yaml_sensor_generation

Also, probably the Wiki page/tutorial would need to be updated/renamed

Also, if you feel like you want to change behavior or agrs or anything in utils.py to better suit your needs, go for it, it is definitely not as generic or simple as it could be!

content.raw: Hi Tyler, so these functions work and were originally used by `create_xacro_file`, but do not fit there super well, but kept them around for the compliance testing. ie: compliance may want to utilize a directory where all the allowed xacros are kept \(or kept in child directories of the main\). This is almost the current structure, so I though it might be handy to keep around until we are sure no compliance tests will use them.

This is almost the current structure, so I though it might be handy to keep around until we are sure no compliance tests will use them.

content.raw: Great, I will put them back in there and just leave a comment noting its intended use. Thank you!
